txt.en:
'A champion is happiest in battle, [placeholder], protecting the weak and fighting for the helpless. I can see in your eye that you have already come to understand that. Now you need to hone your skills so you may survive the difficulties this calling will set before you!

'There is a mighty champion, a dwarf by the name of Ultan Foebane, who is sure to give you some advice to help you become even stronger, if you can prove that you are worthy of being called a champion. I know that you can prove this to him, [placeholder].

'As I heard it, Ultan Foebane was looking for adventurers at the Combe-gate, on the eastern side of town. Present yourself to him and be ready to prove yourself a champion!'

'As I heard it, Ultan Foebane was looking for adventurers at the Combe-gate, on the eastern side of town of Bree. Present yourself to him and be ready to prove yourself a champion!'
A Blade of Renown

Collected Ultan Foebane's Notes
'I gave you my notes on the locations of three deadly foes, [placeholder]. Dispatch these opponents and return and I will give you some small measure of training! Are you a champion or are you not?'

'A champion is happiest in battle, [placeholder], protecting the weak and fighting for the helpless. I can see in your eye that you have already come to understand that. Now you need to hone your skills so you may survive the difficulties this calling will set before you!

'There is a mighty champion, a dwarf by the name of Ultan Foebane, who is sure to give you some advice to help you become even stronger, if you can prove that you are worthy of being called a champion. I know that you can prove this to him, [placeholder].

'As I heard it, Ultan Foebane was looking for adventurers at the Combe-gate, on the eastern side of town of Bree. Present yourself to him and be ready to prove yourself a champion!'
'Look for Ultan Foebane at the Combe-gate on the east side of the town of Bree. He has been looking for stalwart champions whose mettle he can test ever since he came to Bree-land.'

Ultan Foebane is at the Combe-gate on the east side of the town of Bree.\n\nYou have been told to speak with Ultan Foebane, a mighty champion travelling through the Bree-land, for the dwarf may be able to help you become stronger.
'Look for Ultan Foebane at the Combe-gate on the east side of town. He has been looking for stalwart champions whose mettle he can test ever since he came to Bree-land.'

Ultan Foebane has given you a list containing the locations of three deadly enemies to dispatch.\n\nTo prove you are a worthy champion, Ultan Foebane has tasked you with slaying three threats to the folk of Bree-land.
'Look for Ultan Foebane at the Combe-gate on the east side of the town of Bree. He has been looking for stalwart champions whose mettle he can test ever since he came to Bree-land.'

'You are a champion's champion, [placeholder], and I don't mind saying so!'
'You have proven yourself to me, and to your opponents as well!'

'You say you're a champion, [placeholder], but I have to tell you that I've never heard of you. What great deeds have you performed? None that I have seen, and still there is great danger in the surrounding countryside!

'I will recognize you as a champion only if you can slay three of the evils that threaten this town of Men. I give you their names and their favourite haunts and ask only that you end them and return to me!

'With the use of these notes, a real champion would be able to bring safety to these lands and inspire the people with word of his deeds.'

'News of your battles come before you, [placeholder], for the whole town speaks of them!

'Zhurpukh of the Deeps will no more sneak from the marshes in search of open windows and unlatched doors! Fair Sherman? More lovely in death, they say! And of Morley the Fierce, the people say only this -- that he was not fierce enough to best [placeholder], a worthy champion indeed!

'The people in this town of Men speak the truth, friend champion. I will give you some measure of instruction in the fighting arts, the better to improve the strikes you make at your enemies!'
The name of a champion goes before him, carried on the wind by those for whom he fights. It cows his enemies and lifts the hearts of good people everywhere.
'Zhurpukh will slay them all!'
'Zhurpukh runs with the speed of falling shadows!'
'Zhurpukh is mighty!'

'A champion is happiest in battle, [placeholder], protecting the weak and fighting for the helpless. I can see in your eye that you have already come to understand that. Now you need to hone your skills so that you may survive the difficulties this calling will set before you!
